Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision rejecting refugee claim
Evidence_Assessment: K.K.'s past interactions with authorities, lack of LTTE connections
Decision_Outcome: Refusal to grant Convention refugee or protected person status
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate risk of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Board made credibility findings regarding K.K.'s claims
Legal_Rule: Standard of review for factual determinations is reasonableness
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of serious persecution upon return to home country
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board's decision found within acceptable range
Key_Evidence_Considered: Past interactions with authorities, absence of political organization ties
Legal_Framework: Canadian administrative law, refugee determination framework
Applicant_Challenge: Board unreasonably assessed risks and credibility
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on standard of review
Defendant_Response: Board concluded no serious risk of persecution
Remedy_Requested: Granting of refugee status or protected person status
Resolution_Mechanism: Federal Court review under reasonableness standard
Legal_Provision: Section 96-98, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee definition and risk assessment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: No credible basis for fear of persecution
Applicable_Process: Refugee appeal and judicial review process
Governing_Rule: Principles of administrative law governing reasonableness review
